titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Cornwall Minister Collection 1796-1943 MS 020 MS 020 MS 020
titlestmt.author: Processed by Ryan Bachman

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2017-02-02 07:54:02 -0800.

did.abstract: This collection reflects Cornwall historian E.C. Starr’s personal interest in theological matters and Protestant clergyman.

custodhist.head: Provenance
custodhist.p: These documents were collected entirely by Starr, with the exception of Mrs. Emily Foley Foster’s obituary, which was added to the collection following his death, likely by Emily E. Marsh.

archdesc.userestrict:
Use Restrictions Permission to publish materials must be obtained in writing from the:
Research library
Cornwall Historical Society
7 Pine Street
PO Box 115
Cornwall, CT 06753
Phone: 860-672-0505
E-mail: CornHistSoc@optonline.net

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Published citations should take the following form:
Identification of item, date (if known); The Cornwall Minister Collection; MS 020; box number; folder number; Cornwall Historical Society

bioghist.head: Historical/Biographical Note
bioghist.p: This collection reflects Cornwall historian E.C. Starr’s personal interest in theological matters and Protestant clergyman. Starr was himself a Congregationalist minister, and during his lifetime he gathered items related to other local preachers. Some of the men found in this collection were Cornwall-area natives, while others worked in Cornwall, or traveled to Cornwall for recreation.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: This collection includes materials about Cornwall Minister from 1796-1943.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Folders are arranged alphabetically by subject/author heading then chronologically within each subject/author heading.
The files are grouped into 2 series:

did.unittitle: Newspaper clipping about Canaan native, Rev. Barnett
Record of his life sent to Mr. Calhoun
Letter from Beecher to W.H. Brown, about a marriage appointment
New York Times article, “A Plea For ‘More Than Tolerance"
Program from Coll’s installation as pastor of North Cornwall Church
Marriage notice for John Welch and Elizabeth Bell
Family correspondence with E.C. Starr, regarding personal and church history
Printed funeral address given at Cornwall
Printed memorial discourse for Reverend Fenn
Program for 76th Anniversary of New Haven Baptist Association, autographed by Foster
Letter sent to E.C. Starr, regarding speaking engagement
Dissertation of Mrs. A.K. Foster, Emily Howard Foley Foster, “The Language of the Northumbrian Gloss to the Gospel of St. Matthew"
Letter sent to “Mr. Nickerson” about scholarships
Discourse delivered at Rev. Jackson’s funeral
Collected correspondence of E.C. Starr regarding Jackson’s theology and Cornwall roots
Issues of The Worker featuring articles by Leathers
First Congregational Church application card from pastorate of E.O. Mead
Newspaper article regarding Mollineaux eloping with a married woman
Letter sent to E.C. Starr from B.W. Pettibone
Historical sketch on various ministers, by Pierpont
Brief sketch on life and career
Acceptance letter, joining Cornwall’s First Church
Copy of writ of attachment against Prince
Letter about Prince sent to E.C. Starr by his widow
Copy of The Topeka Daily Capital, edited by Sheldon
Letter sent from D.N. Camp to E.C. Starr, about Smalley
Church anniversary booklet, with portrait of Smalley
Text of sermon preached at Lee, Mass.
Correspondence with Frederick Kellogg, about accepting First Church pulpit
Semi-Centennial booklet of Torrington Third Church, mentioning Smith
Article, “Home Missions and the Mormon Problem"
Note from Dartmouth College, regarding Weston’s background
Thanksgving sermon given at North Cornwall
Correspondence between E.C. Starr and Mrs. Charles Wetherby, about her late husband
Walton, NY newspaper with story on White’s death
“Historical Catalogue of the Theological Institute of Connecticut,” mentioning Reverends Ives, Day, Pratt, and St. John, associated with Cornwall
